General.text:
80-100% oral bioavailability as opposed to
furosemide
[1]

Adult_Dosing.text:
40mg
furosemide
= 20mg
torsemide
= 1mg bumetanide = 50 mg
ethacrynic acid
0.5 to 1 mg IV or 0.5-2mg PO. If inadequate response, repeat q2-3 hours to maximum of 10 mg per day

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: use lowest dose necessary, titrate slowly

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Anuria
Hepatic coma
Severe electrolyte depletion

Common.text:
Hypotenchion
Hypouricemia, hypokalemia, hypochloremia
Cramps
Dizziness, headache
Nausea

Pharmacology.text:
Rapid onset
Half-life: 1-6 hours
Metabolism: Partially metabolized in liver
Excretion: Mostly renal
